column4: I still use my Quicksilver G4 daily with tiger, been eyeing maxing it out with the Maxpower dual 1.8Ghz G4 and a 7800GT AGP
I remebmer there being mandriva and slack ports as well
there was also Mac On Linux, which was an early VM system
it;s ubuntu/linux related, it'd be moreso if Canocial hand;t dropped PPC support...
may want to install with the --install-recommends option as well
ogmrip doesn't make .iso files, it transcodes, and apparently doesn't do webm yet
either way I don't want to transcode, but make an image of the disc
intok if memory serves it does make a copy, no encoding at all.
what does apt-cache search nautilus turn up
for the first choose a root terminal
http://pastebin.com/8nneQ5F5 tried the old scripts pack http://www.ubuntu-unleashed.com/2007/09/125-nautilus-scripts-to-simplify.html but they no longer work in 11.04
the trials and tribulations of running the unofficial port of Ubuntu PPC on a 2002 PowerMac...
